topic.title: Installing Current Transformers for I-Line Subfeeds

body.p: CTs for I-Line subfeeds cannot be factory installed because the internal (line) side of each I-Line CB is connected to a bus bar rather than to cables. Consequently, CTs must be installed over the load cables when the customer’s installer attaches them to the I-Line circuit breakers.
CT sets for I-Line subfeeds are shipped unattached in the I-Line Side Car or Main Cabinet Extension.
CTs for I-Line subfeeds are packaged together in sets of three (3), one (1) set for each subfeed breaker ().
Each CT is labeled by phase (ABC) with an arrow indicating direction of current flow. The arrow should point in the direction of the load when the CT is installed.

Each of the (3) CTs in a set has (2) 7′ wires which are wired together to a 6-pin connector for connection to the BCMS monitoring system. The wires at the BCMS Connector end are also labeled by phase.

body.p: For each load cable into a circuit breaker, install the CT matching that phase over the cable with the arrow pointing towards the load. The ordering of I-Line CBs (CB1, CB2, etc.) is determined by the customer.
The BCMS Connector must be connected to the corresponding breaker socket on a “Resistor Board” (). A label in the I-Line section shows the Resistor Board connector positions for each breaker ().

Usually the Resistor Board cannot be placed in the I-Line section itself because of space limitations. However, the Resistor Board will be placed as close as possible to the I-Line section although the exact position depends on the layout of the PDU.
